intro: Galium timeroyi, commonly known as the Timor bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, and it produces tiny, capsule-like fruits. Galium timeroyi is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves.
